answers.answer:
The matrix after argsort has only 1 row.
`[0][-2]` fetches the second highest value, that corresponds to the sentence with the highet similarity score.
`[-2]` fetches the second value in the matrix after argsort()
`[0][-2]` fetches the value from that's indexed in the first row, second last column of the Cosine Similarity matrix that has multiple rows.

source.guidance: We've included the `user_input` in the sentence tokens. So the highest value in the cosine similarity matrix will be the `user_input` with itself. That's why we want the second highest value.
source.instructions:
## Reading Question
`idx = cosine_sim_matrix.argsort()[0][-2]`
In the above step to calculate Cosine Similarity, why did we pass `-2`, a negative integer for indexing?
source.name: apiBotFinal
